TITLE: Federal judge orders immediate thaw of climate, infrastructure funds
SUMMARY: President Donald Trump does not have "unfettered power to hamstring in perpetuity" duly passed funding laws, the judge ruled.

TITLE: Trump's EPA wages war over $20B in 'gold bars'
SUMMARY: The Biden EPA handed out billions of dollars to bring clean energy technologies to lower-income communities. The Trump administration is trying to take it back.

TITLE: Trump's economic tumult tests the oil industry's patience
SUMMARY: The president's trade war has unnerved investors and executives — and could undermine his pledge to unleash "energy dominance."

TITLE: White House outlines plan to gut NOAA, smother climate research
SUMMARY: The agency’s Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research would be “eliminated as a line office,” according to a memo from the Office of Management and Budget.

TITLE: Trump pick to lead Interior’s land management agency withdraws nomination
SUMMARY: Kathleen Sgamma's withdrawal comes after a 4-year-old memo resurfaced showing she criticized President Donald Trump's role in the Jan. 6 riot at the Capitol.

TITLE: Trump moves to hobble major US climate change study
SUMMARY: The cuts are a potentially fatal blow to the National Climate Assessment that Congress mandated to ensure the government understands the threats posed by rising temperatures.

TITLE: Trump’s new goal: Revive a major climate pollutant that power markets have turned against
SUMMARY: But even coal-friendly Republicans and executives say it won’t revive the industry to its former glory.

TITLE: Noem offers buyouts to DHS workers
SUMMARY: The Homeland Security secretary outlined "workforce transition programs" in an email Monday evening.

TITLE: From pro-climate Republican to ‘one of the Trump disruptors’
SUMMARY: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin's attacks on his agency's spending and regulations have made him a rising star in the Trump Cabinet, but left some former colleagues mystified.

TITLE: Judge hammers EPA over lack of proof of wrongdoing in terminating $20B in climate grants
SUMMARY: "Here we are, weeks in, and you're still unable to proffer me any information with regard to any kind of investigation or malfeasance," U.S. District Judge Tanya Chutkan said.

TITLE: Tesla lurches as Musk hits the gas for Trump
SUMMARY: Dreadful sales numbers are just the latest sign of the EV manufacturer's "crisis tornado."

TITLE: Lawmakers and industry groups blast away at DOE project kill list
SUMMARY: Draft lists of potential cuts have been rocketing around Capitol Hill this week, and lawmakers from both parties are working to save their projects.

TITLE: Trump admin considers killing big energy projects in Dem states
SUMMARY: The cuts, if carried through, would politicize the federal funds that Congress and the Biden administration awarded to seven regional applicants as part of the bipartisan infrastructure law.

TITLE: Climate groups could beat Trump in fight for $20B. It may be too late.
SUMMARY: The controversy over $20 billion of climate grants is stalling projects across the country and could force cancellation of projects designed to help people lower their energy costs.

TITLE: This is the next border fight — and it’s a stinker
SUMMARY: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin is picking a fight with Mexico over sewage flowing into San Diego.

TITLE: Judge bars Trump’s EPA from taking back $20B in climate grants — for now
SUMMARY: The ruling orders EPA and climate change groups to return to court to argue about the fate of the money.

TITLE: At least 26 dead in massive US storm after Kansas reports 8 fatalities
SUMMARY: Authorities in several states blamed tornadoes and traffic pileups due to dust storms for the deaths.

TITLE: Judge slams EPA’s climate grant cancellations: ‘You have to have some kind of evidence’
SUMMARY: Judge Tanya Chutkan offered significant criticism of EPA’s action but stopped short of saying she will side with the Climate United Fund.

TITLE: Oil executives supported Trump. Now he's causing them heartburn.
SUMMARY: Oil and gas executives were big backers of the Republican president and his "energy dominance" message, but the trade fights he's picked are driving up their costs and threatening to undermine the economy.

TITLE: EPA launches attack on ‘holy grail’ of climate science — and dozens of enviro rules
SUMMARY: The move is the most aggressive attack yet by the Trump administration to undo previous efforts to limit the emissions that are warming the planet.

TITLE: EPA's Zeldin terminates $20B in Biden climate grants
SUMMARY: The move comes just one day before a federal judge will hold a hearing in a lawsuit brought by one of the grant recipients seeking access to the funds the Trump administration had frozen while it probed the program.

TITLE: Ontario imposes fee on power exports, warns of potential cutoff over Trump's tariff threats
SUMMARY: The escalation in tensions comes as President Donald Trump seeks to use trade as leverage to strengthen border enforcement.

TITLE: House Republican support grows for keeping clean energy tax breaks
SUMMARY: Lawmakers are expected to start the difficult task this week of determining which of the credits are on the chopping block to help pay for the GOP's budget bill.

TITLE: Climate coalition launches lawsuit against Trump freeze
SUMMARY: The lawsuit represents the latest salvo in a battle with the Trump administration over the agency's Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund.

TITLE: Trump officials escalate fight to take back $20B in climate money
SUMMARY: The Justice Department is demanding documents from nonprofits that were awarded the money through the Inflation Reduction Act.

TITLE: Ontario premier sticks to electricity tariffs despite Trump trade reversal
SUMMARY: The move in response to President Donald Trump's tariffs on Canadian goods could raise costs for 1.5 million customers in three border states.

TITLE: EPA calls for watchdog to probe $20 billion climate fund
SUMMARY: The Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund is at the center of a fight between the Trump administration and environmental groups seeking access to the funds that Congress approved under its massive climate legislation.

TITLE: Groups frozen out of $20B in EPA cash fear bankruptcy
SUMMARY: Some nonprofits are struggling to pay their employees as EPA tries to claw back the Inflation Reduction Act funding.

TITLE: Venezuela’s opposition leader defends Trump’s move to cancel oil licenses
SUMMARY: Maria Corina Machado, the most prominent figure in the country’s opposition movement, argued the measures are needed to stop government repression.

TITLE: Trump pulls Chevron license to export Venezuela oil, reversing Biden deal
SUMMARY: The move, set to take effect March 1, comes as the Trump administration resets foreign relation policies stretching back decades.
